decks.notes: The main concept of this Dredge combo deck is to play cards that allow you to quickly fill your graveyard with creatures like Golgari Grave-Troll, Shambling Shell, and Stinkweed Imp. By dredging these cards into your graveyard, you can trigger powerful effects like bringing back Prized Amalgam and Narcomoeba, while also enabling cards like Bridge from Below and Creeping Chill. Additionally, the deck includes disruption spells like Force of Will and Cabal Therapy to disrupt your opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm your opponent with a flood of creatures and graveyard synergy.

This deck focuses on creating infinite turns by utilizing cards like Time Vault and Voltaic Key. It includes powerful tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find combo pieces quickly. The deck also has card draw and selection spells like Brainstorm and Ponder to assemble the combo efficiently. To protect the combo, it includes counter spells like Force of Will and Mindbreak Trap. Additionally, the deck can disrupt opponents with cards like Notion Thief and Duress. Overall, the goal is to assemble the combo pieces and take multiple turns in a row to win the game.

This deck focuses on a strategy of aggressive play with a focus on artifacts. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan by using cards like Phyrexian Revoker, Sorcerous Spyglass, and Chalice of the Void to shut down their key cards and abilities. The deck also utilizes powerful artifacts like Karn, Scion of Urza and Mystic Forge to generate card advantage and provide additional threats on the board. Additionally, the deck utilizes lands like Mishra's Workshop, Ancient Tomb, and Wasteland to generate quick mana and disrupt the opponent's mana base.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful planeswalkers, counterspells, and card advantage. It utilizes efficient mana acceleration and card selection to quickly establish board presence. By combining powerful artifacts like Time Vault and Manifold Key with planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents. With a mix of removal, card draw, and counterspells, the deck seeks to control the game until it can assemble a winning combination or overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck focuses on utilizing powerful graveyard recursion strategies with cards like Bazaar of Baghdad, Vengevine, and Hogaak, Arisen Necropolis to quickly overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures. It also includes disruption elements like Force of Vigor and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the deck can execute its aggressive strategy effectively. The deck aims to generate early pressure and close out games quickly before the opponent can stabilize, leveraging its graveyard synergies to maintain a consistent stream of threats throughout the game.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing a combination of counterspells, draw spells, and removal to disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also relies on powerful planeswalker cards like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy, Oko, Thief of Crowns, and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate value and gain advantages on the battlefield. With a mix of powerful card draw and mana acceleration from Moxen, the deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent to secure victory through superior resource management and strategic gameplay.

The deck revolves around using planeswalkers and control elements to maintain board presence and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By utilizing cards like Force of Will, Pyroblast, and Lightning Bolt for removal, along with powerful planeswalkers like Wrenn and Six, Oko, and Narset, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It also includes card draw and manipulation spells like Brainstorm, Ancestral Recall, and Preordain to ensure consistency and find key pieces. Additionally, it runs a small creature package with Tarmogoyf and Dreadhorde Arcanist for additional threats.

The deck aims to generate a large amount of mana quickly through artifacts and spells, then use Paradoxical Outcome to draw multiple cards and replay the artifacts for more mana. The key is to chain spells together efficiently to draw into key combo pieces like Bolas's Citadel or Tinker, enabling the player to win the game in a single explosive turn. The deck also includes disruption in the form of countermagic and disruptive creatures like Lavinia to protect the combo and control the opponent's actions.

This deck focuses on assembling the "Doomsday" combo, a powerful win condition that allows the player to manipulate their library and win the game on the spot. By using cards like Demonic Tutor, Vampiric Tutor, and Mystical Tutor to find and set up the necessary cards, the deck aims to efficiently cast Doomsday and win through a combination of cards like Thassa's Oracle and Demonic Consultation. The deck includes a variety of powerful draw spells, counterspells, and disruptive cards to protect the combo and ensure a quick and unstoppable victory.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the combo pieces needed to win the game with Thassa's Oracle and Doomsday. It includes a variety of card draw and manipulation spells to help dig for the combo pieces as well as disruptive cards like Force of Will and Flusterstorm to protect the combo. The deck also includes tutors like Demonic Tutor and Vampiric Tutor to find key cards quickly, while also having some interaction with the opponent through cards like Daze and Force of Negation. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo and win the game before the opponent can respond.

The main focus of this deck is to aggressively utilize cards like Hollow One, Vengevine, and Hogaak to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Stitcher's Supplier to fill the graveyard, this deck aims to quickly put pressure on the opponent by constantly bringing back threats from the graveyard and establishing a strong board presence. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Cabal Therapy and Force of Vigor also help to disrupt the opponent's game plan and ensure the deck's aggressive strategy can go uncontested.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Underworld Breach deck focuses on using various powerful spells and mana artifacts to quickly fill the graveyard with cards before utilizing Underworld Breach to cast those spells from the graveyard. With a mix of cheap interaction, card draw, and powerful threats like Managorger Hydra and planeswalkers like Dack Fayden, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they can react effectively. It combines efficient card selection and mana acceleration to set up explosive plays and outmaneuver opponents.

The deck focuses on using Oath of Druids as a control strategy to cheat powerful creatures into play early in the game, such as Griselbrand and Niv-Mizzet, Parun. It also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Pyroblast to control the game and protect its game plan. Additionally, it includes cards like Narset, Parter of Veils and Oko, Thief of Crowns to further disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain card advantage. The mana base is designed to support the deck's dual-colored requirements and maximize consistency.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the powerful combo potential of Underworld Breach in conjunction with cards like Brain Freeze, Ancestral Recall, and Demonic Tutor to quickly assemble a winning combination. The deck includes a variety of card draw, counterspells, and mana acceleration to ensure the combo can be executed efficiently. Additionally, powerful cards like Force of Will and Dack Fayden provide additional protection and disruption to control the game and push towards victory. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a lethal combo before they can effectively respond.

The main concept of this Combo-Dredge deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Grave-Troll, enabling you to trigger powerful graveyard-based effects. By utilizing cards like Bazaar of Baghdad and Cabal Therapy, you can easily get these cards into your graveyard, while cards like Narcomoeba and Bridge from Below allow you to generate additional creatures and value. This deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a combination of creature recursion, graveyard synergy, and explosive combos to win the game by outpacing and out-valuing your opponent.

Utilizing fast mana and card draw, the deck aims to quickly assemble the necessary combo pieces to generate a high storm count and win the game with a lethal Bolas's Citadel or a large Tendrils of Agony. The deck protects itself with counterspells and disruptive permanents like Narset, Parter of Veils and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade, while also having access to powerful tutors and card selection to find the win conditions efficiently. The deck aims to quickly and efficiently go off before the opponent can disrupt its game plan.
